title: "Function Reference"

Complete reference for all tabviz functions, organized by category.

## Core Functions

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [`tabviz()`](tabviz.qmd) | **Main entry point** - Create interactive tables with any columns |
| [`save_plot()`](export.qmd) | Export to SVG, PNG, or PDF |

```r
# Create a table with a forest plot column
tabviz(data, label = "study", columns = list(
  col_forest(point = "hr", lower = "lo", upper = "hi"),
  col_numeric("hr", "HR"),
  col_pvalue("pval")
))
```

## Styling Functions

Apply styling using the fluent API with pipes:

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [`set_row_style()`](styling.qmd#set_row_style) | Row-level styling (bold, italic, color, type, indent) |
| [`set_marker_style()`](styling.qmd#set_marker_style) | Style interval markers (color, shape, opacity, size) |
| [`set_column_style()`](styling.qmd#set_column_style) | Per-cell styling for specific columns |
| [`set_theme()`](styling.qmd#set_theme) | Apply a theme by name or object |

::: {.callout-note}
## Constructor Arguments vs Fluent API

Every styling function has equivalent direct arguments in `tabviz()`:

```r
# These produce identical results:
tabviz(data, ..., row_bold = "is_summary", marker_color = "dir_color")

tabviz(data, ...) |>
  set_row_style(bold = "is_summary") |>
  set_marker_style(color = "dir_color")
```

Use direct arguments when configuration is known upfront. Use the fluent API when styling depends on computation.
:::
